element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm performs a qualitative analysis of the surface, applying a local analysis.

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: * R. Dikau. The application of a digital relief model to landform analysis in geomorphology. In J. Raper, editor, Three Dimensional Applications in Geographical Information Systems, pages 51-77. Taylor & Francis, London, 1989. * E.E. Dikau, R. Brabb and R.M Mark. Landform classiffication of New Mexico by computer. U.S. Dept Interior, U.S. Geological Survey., 1991.

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The method to use may be selected from the following: * Mark highest neighbor * Opposite neighbors * Flow Direction * Peucker & Douglas

element.name: RESULT
element.text: In the case of Peucker & Douglas the values in each cell may be assigned from the following categories: * 9 = Peak (summit) * -9 = Pit * 0 = Plane * 1 = Pass * 2 = Convex break line * -2 = Concave break line * 7 = Ridge (crest) * -7 = Channel
